formattedAddress: 998 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 998 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Easygoing Japanese restaurant specializing in sushi rolls & sashimi, plus ramen, bowls & sake.

originalText.text: Friday and Saturday cash only. The food and service are fine. The waiter and waitress are nice and friendly. The atmosphere is not very nice. It's loud and crowded.

text.text: Friday and Saturday cash only. The food and service are fine. The waiter and waitress are nice and friendly. The atmosphere is not very nice. It's loud and crowded.

originalText.text: I had a dinner with my friend over there and Was nice , there sushi is delicious the people very kindly

text.text: I had a dinner with my friend over there and Was nice , there sushi is delicious the people very kindly

originalText.text: My first visit to this uptown location, and it's now my favorite! Nicely styled interior, very clean and comfortable. More space per table and a nice view of chefs prep area, unlike their other locations. Also seems to be quieter/less of a party place. Sushi was excellent, super fresh and not too much rice on the AYCE option, also delivered very quickly. Will definitely return.

text.text: My first visit to this uptown location, and it's now my favorite! Nicely styled interior, very clean and comfortable. More space per table and a nice view of chefs prep area, unlike their other locations. Also seems to be quieter/less of a party place. Sushi was excellent, super fresh and not too much rice on the AYCE option, also delivered very quickly. Will definitely return.

originalText.text:
First time visiting this Kikoo location - pretty disappointed and don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be coming back.

First and foremost, the waitstaff are really rude here. My friend got to the restaurant and sat down first, and she told them that I‚Äôd be there in 5 minutes. This was about 65 minutes before closing time (which is enough time for us to eat), but the waitstaff REPEATEDLY lectured her that we‚Äôd have to be out the door by 10, no exceptions, and kept pestering her every minute about how much longer until I‚Äôd arrive ‚Ä¶ When I arrived 5 minutes later as promised, a waiter was leaning outside the door and I told him ‚ÄúI‚Äôm with her‚Äù but couldn‚Äôt even finish my sentence before he interrupted ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù with a cold face. Like ok.. and when I walked in, there was a bunch of waitstaff just standing around at the front but everyone just seemed very cold, no smiles or hellos.

When we were almost done eating, a lady came to tell my table that it was the kitchen‚Äôs last call, I quickly picked up the tablet to order an ice cream, and she was just breathing down my shoulder the whole time .. and before I could barely press Send, she literally snatched the tablet from me and walked off. ü§®

In terms of food, there seems to be a smaller food selection here (ex. No stir fry vegetables, teriyaki salmon/chicken, fried squid (my favorite)). However, the sashimi does seem to be a little fresher/tender than the other Kikoo location.

All in all, food was okay but the uncomfortable/rude service doesn‚Äôt make me want to come back again.

All in all, food was okay but the uncomfortable/rude service doesn‚Äôt make me want to come back again.

originalText.text:
I have never felt so disregarded and disrespected as a customer before. My friends and I went for the all you can eat sushi and it‚Äôs as if we didn‚Äôt exist. The hostess told us to sit anywhere we wanted and then didn‚Äôt come over until we asked her. When we asked, she gave us a nasty look and told us we had to wait to be served. Then we got the IPad where we ordered our food, and it‚Äôs as if we weren‚Äôt there. We asked for extra napkins amongst other seemingly normal requests, and every time we either were told we had to wait or we just got an awful response.

The restaurant was empty so it didn‚Äôt seem like she had to run from table to table and serve many parties. Part of the experience of eating is the service and no matter how good the food was, and it was good, the whole experience was ruined by how horrible she was. No amount of delicious food will make up for how we felt the whole time.
